# Zener Diode

<span style="color:#000000">A </span> Zener diode  <span style="color:#000000">is a silicon </span>  <span style="color:#000000"> _pn_ </span>  <span style="color:#000000"> _ _ </span>  <span style="color:#000000">junction device\.</span>

<span style="color:#0000cc">Designed for operation in the reverse region</span>  <span style="color:#000000">\. </span>

<span style="color:#000000">The breakdown voltage of a Zener diode is set by carefully controlling the doping level during manufacture\.</span>

Recall diode reaches reverse breakdown\, its voltage remains almost constant even though the current changes drastically\, and this is the key to Zener diode operation\.

<span style="color:#c00000"> __Breakdown Characteristics__ </span>

Zeners are commercially available with breakdown voltages from less than 1V to more than 250 V with specified tolerances from 1% to 20%\.

When reverse voltage \( _V_ R\) is increased\, the reverse current \( _I_ R\) remains extremely small up to the “knee” of the curve\.

<span style="color:#336600">Reverse current is also called the Zener current\, </span>  <span style="color:#336600"> _I_ </span>  <span style="color:#336600">Z</span>  <span style="color:#336600">\.</span>
